result.execSummary:
The defendant David John Trovillion #362357 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David John Trovillion #362357 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David John Trovillion #362357 was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Court deems this sentence as served.
Concurrent with: Sentence def is currently serving in Ashland Case #13CF19.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David John Trovillion #362357

defendant.name: Trovillion #362357, David John
defendant.address: 1 W. Lincoln St. P.O. Box 661, Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963-0661

records.addlTxt: of Plea & Sentence Held 8-16-17

Defendant David John Trovillion in court, in custody, with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Spec. Pros calls cases 16CF30 and 16CF35 at 9:42 a.m.  Cites appearances and states agreement for Court.  Atty Randtke agrees as stated.  Def pleads NC to Count #1 in 16CF35 and Count #2 in 16CF30.  PLQ filed with Court.  Def admits signing document and giving answers without coercion.  Atty Randtke satisfied def freely, knowingly and intelligently pleads.  Court finds def guilty of counts as stated.  Right of allocution given but def has nothing for record.  Court follows agreement.  For Count #2 in 16CF30, Court sentences def to 12 months incarceration concurrent with Ashland County sentence.  Credit for time served.  On 16CF35, Count #1, Court sentences def to 1 year Prison/1 year ES, one set of court costs, consecutive to Ashland County case #13CF19 sentence def is currently serving.  Court determines def eligible for CIP and Substance Abuse Program.  Per atty Randtke, reiterates that time served on 16CF30.  Court agrees and dismisses other count addressed.  DNA sample and surcharge waived.  Sample on file.  Adj.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Attorney S. Joseph Randtke in court.  Def not present.  Frederick J. Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cases at 10:08 a.m.  (Also calls 16CF35)  Cites appearances.  DA Schellgell gives court background re progress of cases.  Requests adjournment.  Court grants adjournment.  Cases to be scheduled.  Adjourned at 10:10 a.m.  klr
Signature bond returned/refused to sign
This bond covers 16CF30 and 16CF35.

11:16 a.m.  David Trovillion appears, unrepresented.  Frederick j. Schellgell appears for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case, cites appearances.  Public defender information provided to defendant again.  DA requests bond be changed to a signature bond of $1,000 instead of a cash bond.  Court inquires if defendant would like to be heard.  Defendant indicates "no".  Court grants DA's motion to amend bond.  Bond covers both cases.  klr
Jury trial - 12 person on February 1, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial on February 23, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant David John Trovillion in court, lodged.   Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calls cases 16CF30 and 16CF35, cites appearances.  Prelim is needed in 16CF35.  Public defender information is given to def again.  Defendant addresses court.   States he has contacted PD and no attorney available until December.  Def states he wants to waive preliminary hearing.  Court questions def re waiver.  Defendant understands and still wants to waive prelim.  court grants waiver or prelim so continue to arraignment.  Information is given to court, copy to def.  Defendant understands charges on information.  Pleads NG.  Clerk to enter.  Set for trial.  Adj. at 11:35 a.m.
Status hearing on October 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David John Trovillion in court.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case.  Cites appearances.  Public defender information was given to defendant again to contact.  All rights are preserved by court.  State objects to T/L for prelim as already waived.  Court agrees.  Court questions defendant re: counsel.  May want to represent himself.  Bond to continue.  klr

Defendant David John Trovillion in court with attorney Sam Joseph Filippo.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case, cites appearances.  Officer Paul S. sworn in, direct by DA.  Exhibit #1 and #2, marked/offerred/recieved.  Cross by atty Filippo, Exhibit #3, marked.  Redirect by DA Schellgell.  No recross.  Witness released.  Alice P. sworn in, direct by atty Filippo.  Exhibit #4 marked.  Cross by atty Schellgell.  Witness released.  Officer Paul S. back to stand for more redirect by atty Schellgell.  Cross by Atty Filippo.  Exhibit #4 offerred/recieved.   Attorney Schellgell argues P.C. exists.  Filippo argues no P.C.  Court finds P.C. exists and binds def over for trial.  Information filed, defendant waives reading and proceeds to Argn.  Pleads not guilty.  Files Demand for Speedy Trial.  To be scheduled.  klr
